text.content: module to build flexbox layout in Angular templates and its hidden features.

rich_text.plain_text: module to build flexbox layout in Angular templates and its hidden features.

text.content: Angular Flex-Layout is an npm package made by Angular team officially.

rich_text.plain_text: Angular Flex-Layout is an npm package made by Angular team officially.

text.content: Angular Flex Layout provides a sophisticated layout API using Flexbox CSS + mediaQuery. This module provides Angular developers with component layout features using a custom Layout API, mediaQuery observables, and injected DOM flexbox-2016 CSS stylings.

rich_text.plain_text: Angular Flex Layout provides a sophisticated layout API using Flexbox CSS + mediaQuery. This module provides Angular developers with component layout features using a custom Layout API, mediaQuery observables, and injected DOM flexbox-2016 CSS stylings.

text.content: Angular Flex-Layout provides some NgModules which exports directives. You can make a declarative layout structure by using Flexbox or CSS Grid.

rich_text.plain_text: Angular Flex-Layout provides some NgModules which exports directives. You can make a declarative layout structure by using Flexbox or CSS Grid.

text.content: Install the package with npm/yarn after creating a project with Angular CLI. Flex-Layout depends on Component DevKit (CDK), so you need additional installation if you haven‚Äôt installed it.

rich_text.plain_text: Install the package with npm/yarn after creating a project with Angular CLI. Flex-Layout depends on Component DevKit (CDK), so you need additional installation if you haven‚Äôt installed it.

text.content: The previous row-based example has a problem with the mobile viewport. Let‚Äôs make its card size responsive!

rich_text.plain_text: The previous row-based example has a problem with the mobile viewport. Let‚Äôs make its card size responsive!

text.content: To implement this, you have to use CSS media queries and define breakpoints in order to determine which size is small or medium. A natural implementation may become like below;

rich_text.plain_text: To implement this, you have to use CSS media queries and define breakpoints in order to determine which size is small or medium. A natural implementation may become like below;

text.content:
<style>
  .cardList {
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: row;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: flex-start;
  }
  /* Column Gap */
  .cardList > * {
    box-sizing: border-box;
  }
  .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 32px;
  }
  /* Item sizing */
  .cardListItem {
    flex: 0 1 calc(33.3% - 32px);
  }
  /* medium size viewport */
  @media screen and (max-width: 959px) {
    /* Column Gap */
    .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
      margin-right: 32px;
    }
    /* Item sizing */
    .cardListItem {
      flex: 0 1 calc(50% - 32px);
    }
  }
  /* small size viewport */
  @media screen and (max-width: 599px) {
    .cardList {
      display: flex;
      flex-direction: column;
      justify-content: flex-start;
    }
    .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
      margin-right: unset;
      margin-bottom: 32px;
    }
  }
</style>

rich_text.plain_text:
<style>
  .cardList {
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: row;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: flex-start;
  }
  /* Column Gap */
  .cardList > * {
    box-sizing: border-box;
  }
  .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
    margin-right: 32px;
  }
  /* Item sizing */
  .cardListItem {
    flex: 0 1 calc(33.3% - 32px);
  }
  /* medium size viewport */
  @media screen and (max-width: 959px) {
    /* Column Gap */
    .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
      margin-right: 32px;
    }
    /* Item sizing */
    .cardListItem {
      flex: 0 1 calc(50% - 32px);
    }
  }
  /* small size viewport */
  @media screen and (max-width: 599px) {
    .cardList {
      display: flex;
      flex-direction: column;
      justify-content: flex-start;
    }
    .cardList > *:not(:last-child) {
      margin-right: unset;
      margin-bottom: 32px;
    }
  }
</style>
